intro: Hieracium tommasinianum subsp. setosissimum, commonly known as the Setose Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring a hairy stem and basal rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is known for its aggressive spreading habit.
